bibl.title: Fatira (Abu Zabal) and Ghozza - Two New Kingdom and Ptolemaic Gold Working Sites in the Eastern Desert of Egypt.

series.title: Supplément aux Annales du Service des Antiquités de l'Égypte. Cahier

bibl.note: Description of 2 gold production sites, Fatira and Ghozza, in the North Eastern Desert. After an interruption from about 1100 B.C., they both were reopened in Ptolemaic times. From Roman-Byzantine periods no indications have been detected until now, but at both sites strongly fortified Roman way stations were built.
bibl.seg: KLEMM Rosemarie and Dietrich KLEMM, Fatira (Abu Zabal) and Ghozza - Two New Kingdom and Ptolemaic Gold Working Sites in the Eastern Desert of Egypt. Avec résumé en anglais.

Khaled DAOUD, Shafia BEDIER and Sawsan ABD EL-FATAH (Edd.), Studies in Honor of Ali Radwan = Supplément aux Annales du Service des Antiquités de l'Égypte. Cahier 34, 2 (Le Caire, 2005) pp. 95-111, 9 pll.

Description of 2 gold production sites, Fatira and Ghozza, in the North Eastern Desert. After an interruption from about 1100 B.C., they both were reopened in Ptolemaic times. From Roman-Byzantine periods no indications have been detected until now, but at both sites strongly fortified Roman way stations were built.
